repositories.new_features_summary: Improved error messages for external declarations, better type printing in row types, memprof compositional improvements
repositories.new_features:
- Enhanced **error messages** for external declarations with non-syntactic arity now show proper error instead of internal failure ([#14146](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14146))
- Improved **type printing** in error messages by showing row types when they are type constructors, making `< bar : int; foo : int; .. as $1>` visible instead of hidden ([#14147](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14147))
- **Gc.Memprof** interface made more compositional allowing `start` to be called when profile already sampling, with new `is_sampling` function ([#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14053))
- **Symbol naming** reverted to using `.` as module separator on non-Apple Unix systems to restore perf tool support ([#14150](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14150))
- **C++ compatibility** improvements by moving atomic helper type definitions inside `caml/misc.h` ([#14139](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14139))
- **Constraint terminology** cleanup renaming `cstrs` to `constraints` throughout codebase to avoid confusion with constructors ([#14141](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14141))
- **Minor heap decommission** fix ensuring domains properly decommit minor heap when leaving STW participant set ([#14152](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14152))
- **Consistent GC logging** using `caml_gc_log` instead of `CAML_GC_MESSAGE` for memprof minor GC operations ([#14151](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14151))
- **Package type cleanup** removing unused `tpt_type` field from `package_type` in typedtree ([#14148](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14148))
- **Test suite improvements** fixing unexecuted phrases in expect tests and missing expectations ([#14155](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14155))

group_summaries.activity_summary: Three merged PRs in Eio plus ongoing technical discussions across multiple repositories about system compatibility and concurrency patterns
group_summaries.activity:
- **Eio v1.3 release** delivered by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with comprehensive bug fixes including FreeBSD `O_RESOLVE_BENEATH` support, Windows stdin broken-pipe fixes, and POSIX `spawn_unix` error handling improvements in [ocaml-multicore/eio#814](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/814)
- **Test infrastructure improvements** by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) to prevent CI failures when fixed buffers are unavailable, tested with `ulimit -l 100` constraints in [ocaml-multicore/eio#815](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/815)
- **Documentation improvements** by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) addressing odoc_driver warnings with corrected cross-references, canonical tags, and opam file dependencies for docs-ci in [ocaml-multicore/eio#813](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/813)
- **ZFS compatibility discussion** where [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) received information about upstream OpenZFS fix for hanging with fixed buffers, available in versions 2.3.3 and 2.2.8 in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#113](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/113)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **ZFS fixed buffer compatibility** issue in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#113](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/113) directly impacts Eio's test infrastructure improvements in [ocaml-multicore/eio#815](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/815), as both address challenges with fixed buffer allocation constraints
- **Fiber management patterns** discussed in [ocaml-multicore/picos#373](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/discussions/373) relate to Eio's fiber-local state inheritance discussion in [ocaml-multicore/eio#807](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/807), highlighting shared challenges in concurrent programming abstractions
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Fiber-local state inheritance** discussion by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) exploring whether domains spawned by Domain Manager should inherit parent fiber's local state, with detailed analysis of current behavior vs expected behavior in [ocaml-multicore/eio#807](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/807)
- **Automatic fiber cancellation** inquiry by [Eli Dowling](https://github.com/faldor20) about creating automatically cancelled fibers without using bundles while developing a libcurl Picos wrapper, seeking transparent solutions for background fiber management in [ocaml-multicore/picos#373](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/discussions/373)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Platform compatibility focus** with systematic addressing of FreeBSD, Windows, and POSIX-specific issues across the multicore ecosystem, particularly in I/O handling and process spawning
- **Development experience improvements** through enhanced test robustness and comprehensive documentation fixes, reducing friction for contributors and users
- **Cross-library concurrency patterns** emerging as developers work on wrapper libraries and explore fiber lifecycle management across different multicore tools
